alert.note: Alert for Kanawha; Northwest Fayette (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 8:39PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Kanawha and northwestern Fayette Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 838 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cedar Grove, or 13 miles southeast of Charleston, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Montgomery, Cedar Grove, East Bank, Glasgow, Smithers, Pratt, Powellton, Handley, Dawes, Pond Gap, and Sharon. This includes West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 70 and 84. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
